A **silver dragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an adult [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") associated with the element of [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Like all dragons, silver dragons are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") - they will also seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") to pick up.

Silver dragons have a cold [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. Silver dragons possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), as well as reflection from their [scales](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scales "Silver dragon scales").

## Generation

Randomly generated silver dragons are always created hostile. A [baby silver dragon](/wiki/Baby_silver_dragon "Baby silver dragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a silver dragon.

Hostile silver dragons can be generated by the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). Characters and monsters that [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing silver dragon scales or [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail") will turn into silver dragons.

Silver dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 15 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Silver dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 silver dragon scales upon death unless [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrated "Disintegrated"), and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was [revived](/wiki/Revived "Revived").

## Strategy

The silver dragon's reflective scales protect it from [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray")-based [spells](/wiki/Spell "Spell") and [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), which significantly limits a character's offensive options against them; fortunately, they only have cold resistance, and their low [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") can still be used against them - [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") is still an effective means of dealing with a silver dragon, and [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") such as [fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire") and [stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud") can severely weaken them. Wielded or thrown [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") (e.g. [sleeping](/wiki/Potion_of_sleeping "Potion of sleeping"), [paralysis](/wiki/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis"), or [oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil")) can soften a silver dragon up for the character's primary melee and/or projectile weapons, but care should be taken not to have them destroyed by its cold breath.

Silver dragons are commonly sought out by characters looking to procure silver dragon scale mail and complement an existing or future source of [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"): they are a somewhat common target for [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") in particular by characters observing [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), or else by characters that have either not yet obtained a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") or are looking to save on one.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Silver dragons are one of the few dragons whose scales do not gain an additional extrinsic property.

Dragons and other large enough monsters can inflict knockback with their melee attacks, making them exceedingly dangerous to fight near [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") and capable of forcing characters back into breath weapon range - the silver dragon's breath weapon can freeze water or lava behind the character if the ray misses, which can partially lower the hazard potential, though this also introduces the possibility of being knocked onto newly-formed [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") and then drowned by rays of [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

### As a pet

As pets and steeds, silver dragons sometimes compete with [gray dragons](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"): both possess flight, useful breath weapons and immunity to death rays. The silver dragon has the added perk of being completely immune to rays (particularly including a [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")'s [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") breath) and reflecting them back at attackers. A silver dragon's breath can also bridge [moats](/wiki/Moat "Moat") for later crossing, though the [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") will not always persist. Unfortunately, on top of a dragon's usual low speed and lack of other resistances, silver dragons can also fall victim to poison or [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap"), which gray dragons are protected against by their intrinsic magic resistance; a character riding a silver dragon prevents them being polymorphed by the trap if they have their own source of magic resistance. There are also many faster and/or stronger steeds than dragons in general, though most of those candidates lack a means of reflection.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Monsters can gain intrinsics from eating corpses, meaning that a silver dragon can be fed in order to gain resistance against common pet-killers such as poison. In particular, silver dragons can gain [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), making it more likely that one brought to the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes") can survive through the [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire").

## History

The silver dragon first appears in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), the last release of [SLASH](/wiki/SLASH "SLASH") based on [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3"), and makes its vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

Many variants alter the silver dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Dragon (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dragon (SLASH'EM)")*

As with most other dragons in SLASH'EM, the silver dragon's [base level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") is raised to 18, their [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is raised to 25, and their [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") is raised to 95 - however, their [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and damage dice are unchanged.

Silver dragons can appear in [dragon lairs](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair") and [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves").

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), the silver dragon's speed is raised to 12.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), the silver dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [digest](/wiki/Digest "Digest") targets.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[chromatic dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)") to appear as silver - the default **reflection dragon** is the amphitere.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), silver dragons have their difficulty slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The silver dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [dragon armor](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)") (such as their scales) or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), silver dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack. Silver dragons do not gain any new intrinsics from their scales, but the scales now confer cold resistance like silver dragons possess intrinsically.

## Encyclopedia entry

In the West the dragon was the natural enemy of man. Although preferring to live in bleak and desolate regions, whenever it was seen among men it left in its wake a trail of destruction and disease. Yet any attempt to slay this beast was a perilous undertaking. For the dragon's assailant had to contend not only with clouds of sulphurous fumes pouring from its fire breathing nostrils, but also with the thrashings of its tail, the most deadly part of its serpent-like body.

\[ Mythical Beasts by Deirdre Headon (The Leprechaun Library) ]

  


"One whom the dragons will speak with," he said, "that is a dragonlord, or at least that is the center of the matter. It's not a trick of mastering the dragons, as most people think. Dragons have no masters. The question is always the same, with a dragon: will he talk to you or will he eat you? If you can count upon his doing the former, and not doing the latter, why then you're a dragonlord."

\[ The Tombs of Atuan, by Ursula K. Le Guin ]

A silver dragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is an adult dragon associated with the element of cold and reflection. Like all dragons, silver dragons are strong, carnivorous, oviparous, thick-skinned, can see invisible, and are capable of flight - they will also seek out gold, gems and magical items to pick up.

Silver dragons have a cold breath weapon, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. Silver dragons possess cold resistance, as well as reflection from their scales.

Randomly generated silver dragons are always created hostile. A baby silver dragon can grow up into a silver dragon.

Hostile silver dragons can be generated by the summon nasties monster spell. Characters and monsters that polymorph while wearing silver dragon scales or silver dragon scale mail will turn into silver dragons.

Silver dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in throne rooms at dungeon levels 15 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[1]

Silver dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 silver dragon scales upon death unless disintegrated, and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was revived.

Strategy

The silver dragon's reflective scales protect it from ray-based spells and wands, which significantly limits a character's offensive options against them; fortunately, they only have cold resistance, and their low MR score can still be used against them - poison is still an effective means of dealing with a silver dragon, and scrolls such as fire and stinking cloud can severely weaken them. Wielded or thrown potions (e.g. sleeping, paralysis, or oil) can soften a silver dragon up for the character's primary melee and/or projectile weapons, but care should be taken not to have them destroyed by its cold breath.

Silver dragons are commonly sought out by characters looking to procure silver dragon scale mail and complement an existing or future source of magic resistance: they are a somewhat common target for reverse genocide in particular by characters observing wishless conduct, or else by characters that have either not yet obtained a wish or are looking to save on one.

A silver dragon's breath can also bridge moats for later crossing, though the ice will not always persist. Dragons and other large enough monsters can inflict knockback with their melee attacks, making them exceedingly dangerous to fight near [[pool]]s or [[lava]] and capable of forcing characters back into breath weapon range - the silver dragon's breath weapon can freeze water or lava behind the character if the ray misses, which can partially lower the hazard potential, though this also introduces the possibility of being knocked onto newly-formed [[ice]] and then drowned by rays of [[fire]].}}

===As a pet===
As pets and steeds, silver dragons sometimes compete with [[gray dragon]]s: both possess flight, useful breath weapons and immunity to death rays. The silver dragon has the added perk of being completely immune to rays (particularly including a [[black dragon]]'s [[disintegration]] breath) and reflecting them back at attackers. A silver dragon's breath can also bridge [[moat]]s for later crossing, though the [[ice]] will not always persist. Unfortunately, on top of a dragon's usual low speed and lack of other resistances, silver dragons can also fall victim to poison or [[polymorph trap]]s, which gray dragons are protected against by their intrinsic magic resistance; a character riding a silver dragon prevents them being polymorphed by the trap if they have their own source of magic resistance. There are also many faster and/or stronger steeds than dragons in general, though most of those candidates lack a means of reflection.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Monsters can gain intrinsics from eating corpses, meaning that a silver dragon can be fed in order to gain resistance against common pet-killers such as poison. In particular, silver dragons can gain [[fire resistance]], making it more likely that one brought to the [[Elemental Planes]] can survive through the [[Plane of Fire]].}}

==History==
The silver dragon first appears in [[SLASH 6]], the last release of [[SLASH]] based on [[NetHack 3.1.3]], and makes its vanilla debut in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Variants==
Many variants alter the silver dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening. 

===SLASH'EM===
{{Main|Dragon (SLASH'EM)}}
As with most other dragons in SLASH'EM, the silver dragon's [[Monster level|base level]] is raised to 18, their [[Monster difficulty|difficulty]] is raised to 25, and their [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] is raised to 95 - however, their [[AC]] and damage dice are unchanged.

Silver dragons can appear in [[dragon lair]]s and [[the Wyrm Caves]].

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], the silver dragon's speed is raised to 12.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], the silver dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [[digest]] targets.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]] and [[DynaHack]], all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[[Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon]] to appear as silver - the default '''reflection dragon''' is the amphitere.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]], and [[notnotdNetHack]], silver dragons have their difficulty slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The silver dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [[Dragon armor (dNetHack)|dragon armor]] (such as their scales) or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], silver dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack. Silver dragons do not gain any new intrinsics from their scales, but the scales now confer cold resistance like silver dragons possess intrinsically.
